channel.title: Help!
channel.description: My internet recently went down and now the only people that can log in to my server are people that use my .no-ip.org. I need help!

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

madgamer:

Most internet providers use a DHCP system to assign client ip addresses. Its very possible that when your internet reconnected, the service provider assigned you a different ip address. So unless all your players were kept up to date about the new change, they would still be using the old ip address which would no longer connect to your computer. This is one reason why no-ip is the best way to go because its always updating itself to your current ip address even when it changes.

Thank you so much! I changed my IP to my no-ip and I tested it out and it works like a charm. Man, I should have done this earlier now I lost the most of my members

EDIT: Is it true that there’s more lag whenever you use no-ip?

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

Most internet providers use a DHCP system to assign client ip addresses. Its very possible that when your internet reconnected, the service provider assigned you a different ip address. So unless all your players were kept up to date about the new change, they would still be using the old ip address which would no longer connect to your computer. This is one reason why no-ip is the best way to go because its always updating itself to your current ip address even when it changes.

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

[quote=“xweetok599, post:8, topic:331671”]But do you mean people can’t join your server when they type in your IP if they go to your server? And if i understand, ur interner doesn’t work? Then this is my answer:
The internet doesn’t work. Then why do you have problems with this? It’s because your internet is down (atleast that is so if i understood your question and if im right lol).[/quote]
My internet went off for a short period of time and when i got it back up the errors started.

Read full topic

But do you mean people can’t join your server when they type in your IP if they go to your server? And if i understand, ur interner doesn’t work? Then this is my answer:
The internet doesn’t work. Then why do you have problems with this? It’s because your internet is down (atleast that is so if i understood your question and if im right lol).

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

moerin:

Start at the begin again. Like you did at the start with running a server with your IP.

[Sat 12:28] Checking Remote IP Address. [Sat 12:28] Current IP address found, using [b](my ip)[/b] for updates. [Sat 12:28] Retrieving hosts, please wait. [Sat 12:28] Host retrieval complete. To add/remove hosts, click here. [Sat 12:28] Updating all checked hosts [Sat 12:28] [b](my no-ip)[/b].no-ip.org: DNS update successful.
This is my log on the no-ip.
I think this is happening because my IP changed after my internet reset.
Is there a way to change my IP back to what it was?

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

moerin:

What’s the problem? Your server is running at No-ip.org?

My server only is able to run to people that use .no-ip.org to log onto it. The people that use the direct IP (my IP), it doesn’t work. Before they would both work. Now that my internet reset only .no-ip.org works. When i opened my no-ip DUC it said something like “Updating DNS” and then it started working with .no-ip.org. So maybe if there’s a way to “Updating DNS” on my IP?

Read full topic
